cab.content: CONFIDENTIALpOCUMENT IS THE PROPERTY OF HER BRITANNIC MAJESTY'S GOVERNMENT(81) 10thillusionsCOPY NO78CABINETCONCLUSIONS of a Meeting of the Cabinetheld at 10 Downing Street onTUESDAY 10 MARCH 1981at 9. 30 amPRESENTThe Rt Hon Margaret Thatcher MPPrime Ministere Rt Hon William Whitelaw MPetary of State for the Home Departmente Rt Hon Peter Walker MPnister of Agriculture, Fisheries and FoodThe Rt Hon Lord Hail shamLord ChancellorThe Rt Hon Sir Geoffrey Howe QC MPChancellor of the ExchequerThe Rt Hon Francis Pym MPChancellor of the Duchy of Lancasterand Paymaster GeneralThe Rt Hon James Prior MPSecretary of State for EmploymentThe Rt Hon Sir Ian Gilmour MPLord Privy SealThe Rt Hon George Younger MPSecretary of State for ScotlandThe Rt Hon Humphrey Atkins MPSecretary of State for Northern IrelandThe Rt Hon John Biffen MPSecretary of State for TradeThe Rt Hon Mark Carlisle QC MPSecretary of State for Education andSciencee Rt Hon Nicholas Edwards MPcretary of State for Walese Rt Hon Patrick Jenkin MPcretary of State for Social Servicese Rt Hon David Howell MPcretary of State for Energye Rt Hon Lord Carringtoncretary of State for Foreign andmmonwealth Affairse Rt Hon Sir Keith Joseph MPcretary of State for Industrye Rt Hon Lord Soamesrd President of the Councile Rt Hon John Nott MPcretary of State for DefenceCONFIDENTIAL CONFIDENTIALie Rt Hon Norman Fowler MP The Rt Hon Leon Brittan 0,d MPcretary * State for Transport Chief Secretary, TreasuryALSO PRESENTThe Rt Hon Michael Jopling MPParliamentary Secretary, TreasurySECRETARYSir Robert ArmstrongSUBJECTTHE BUDGETiiCONFIDENTIAL CONFIDENTIALBUDGET THE CHANCELLOR OF THE EXCHEQUER informed the Cabinetof the proposals in his forthcoming Budget.In accordance with precedent details are not recorded in theCabinet Conclusions.Cabinet Office10 March 1981CONFIDENTIAL
